Medial geniculate body ovoid nucleus.CytoDefiningCriteria: Neurons are bitufted and their dendrites form coils that are encapsulated by myelinated fibers.
Medial geniculate body ovoid nucleus.PartiallyOverlapsWith: Ventral nucleus of medial geniculate body
Medial geniculate body ovoid nucleus.Is part of: Ventral nucleus of medial geniculate body
DefiningCitation: D. K. (1964) The neuronal structure of the medial geniculate body of the cat.  J. Anat.
Medial geniculate body ovoid nucleus.Definition: Part of ventral nucleus of medial geniculate body located ventro-medially, first described by Morest (1964;  http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1261345/?page
